name: Ibis Styles Arles Palais des Congres

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got lost trying to find the hotel. We somehow thought it was in a commercial center, but wasn’t -- it was right near the Musee Departemental Arles Antique which, by the way, was very worthwhile. Our room had a city view and was on the cool side of the building, but overlooked a strange area that looked like a government housing project. There was a sign outside the hotel, which was a combo Mercure/Ibis, about not leaving anything of value in your car, so we complied.
reviews.title: An adequate Mercure

reviews.text: It was a perfectly okay room and the hotel was well maintained.
reviews.title: Bad service.

reviews.text: Have been staying here in the beginning of July. 3* and no glasses in the room? Come on!! Only paper ones for drinking and plastic ones for your bath stuff!
reviews.title: Mercure Arles Camargue

reviews.text: Cleaning staff doesn't respect your privacy at all. How is it possible to enter the room where the sign "Do not disturb" is hanging? One of them knocked and entered right away, I was in bathroom so I didn't have enough time even to get out. The second one just opened the door without any knocking, the third one did the same. And no excuses, how "nice". Nobody talks ANY English. At least 3-5 words!
reviews.title: Outdated but clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A real disappointment. Would never advise anybody this hotel.
reviews.title: The joy of breakfast in your bedroom in Arles

description: The hotel is 1km from the old town centre of Arles and features 80 rooms. A short stroll from the Convention Center and Arles Museum of Archaeology. Restaurant, bar with terrace, conference rooms. Poolside breakfast & meal available in summer. Outdoor closed free carpark.
